name: SEPAK SEKONG
description:
Sepak Sekong is a traditional game that uses flip-flops as a tool. This game requires four sandals. Three sandals are arranged standing like a pyramid, and one is for throwing. This game is done by each player throwing sandals alternately from a predetermined distance with the target pile of sandals earlier. Slippers that are thrown must not float, but must be dragged on the ground.
This game can be played with a minimum of two people but the more people play, the more exciting the game will be. The game starts with each player throwing their sandals. The furthest flipper will be the first thrower. The first pitcher directs his throw in the direction of the slipper. If it is about the arrangement, the second-order thrower will be the guardian of the sandal arrangement, which then arranges the sandal arrangement, and the others hide (like hide and seek).
 
The guard's job is to keep the slipper array standing until all the hiding children are caught. While the task of the child who is hiding is trying to knock down the sandals arrangement without the knowledge of the guard. The sandal guard looks for a friend who is hiding and if caught, the guard must say the name of the child while returning to the sandal arrangement and saying the word "undil-undil" or it can be replaced with another word which means the child has been caught. And so on until all players are caught. Then start all over again. However, if the sandals are broken before all the children are caught, the guards must arrange them and the children who have been caught can go back into hiding.
